content:
Drug: Codeine | cid: 5284371
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Codeine including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: codeine
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Tylenol w/Codeine; Codate; Codephos; Codamol

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Opioid Analgesic; Antitussive

CHEMICAL NAME

(5alpha,6alpha)-7,8-Didehydro-4,5-epoxy-3-methoxy- 17-methylmorphinan-6-ol

DESCRIPTION

Codeine is an opiate used in the treatment of pain and to reduce coughing. It occurs naturally in the opium poppy and as such has a long history of human use.

CAUTION

People seeking codeine experiences from medications that contain acetaminophen (paracetamol) may be putting themselves at risk for acetaminophen-related complications such as liver damage.

                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in Erowid's "Pharmaceuticals Vault" entry for codeine, following the page heading. It provides core information about codeine, including common brand names, effects classification, chemical name, description, and safety cautions about acetaminophen-containing products. Quick links to related topics (effects, health, law, dose, chemistry, general information, FAQs, related substances, and user experiences) are also included, situating this section as an overview and navigation hub for detailed codeine information on the site.
